item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status Live: Here’s how to check allotment status, subscription status, IPO GMP price, and other details - The Financial Express
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status Live

Date: January 3, 2025
Source: Financial Express

This article provides live updates on the IPO allotment status of Indo Farm Equipment, detailing how to check allotment and subscription statuses as well as current GMP prices.

  • The IPO was subscribed 227.67 times overall, with retail investors contributing 101.79 times and NIIs at 501.75 times.
  • Indo Farm Equipment raised Rs 260.15 crore through this IPO.
  • Bidding for the IPO took place from December 31, 2024, to January 2, 2025.
  • The price band for the IPO was set at Rs 204 to Rs 215 per share.
  • The allotment of shares is expected to be finalized today, January 3, 2025, with a listing date on January 7, 2025.
“If we annualize FY25 earnings based on its post-IPO fully diluted paid-up equity capital, the asking price reflects a P/E of 105.39.” – Bajaj Broking

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO represents a significant opportunity for investors, with strong demand reflected in its subscription rates and anticipated market performance.

item.title: Bajaj Housing shares may dive 21%, believes Kotak Equities. Initiates coverage with Rs 100 target - The Economic Times
item.description:
Kotak Equities Predicts 21% Drop in Bajaj Housing Shares with Sell Rating

Publication Date: N/A

Source: ETMarkets.com

Kotak Institutional Equities has initiated a "sell" rating on Bajaj Housing Finance, indicating a potential 21% downside due to high valuations. They project a 25% earnings growth over FY2024-27E, but note risks from competition and rising rates.

  • Kotak initiates coverage with target price of Rs 100.
  • Current stock price suggests a 21% downside risk.
  • Expected earnings growth of 25% CAGR over FY2024-27E.
  • Stable margins and moderate RoE projected due to rising rates.
  • Strong asset quality noted with low NPLs.
  • Key risks include competition and interest rate movements.
“Bajaj Housing Finance trades rich (4.7X book and 39X earnings FY2026E), posing downside risk (21% to our FV of Rs100) and drives our SELL rating,” said Kotak Equities.

In conclusion, despite strong growth projections, Bajaj Housing Finance faces challenges that could impact its performance in the near term.

item.title: ITI Ltd shares soar over 13%, hit new record high in intraday trade - The Economic Times
item.description:
ITI Ltd Shares Soar 20% to Record High in Intraday Trade

Publication Date: Today

Source: Economic Times

Shares of ITI Ltd, an enterprise under the Department of Telecommunications, experienced a significant rise of 13.5% in intraday trade, reaching an all-time high of Rs 432.45.

  • The stock’s total traded value (TTV) reached Rs 2,197.98 crore with 533.35 lakh shares traded.
  • Market capitalization of ITI Ltd stood at Rs 41,029.87 crore.
  • The stock has been on an upward trend since October 2024, rebounding from a low of Rs 210.
  • Shares increased by 37.3% over the past year and surged by 66.5% in the last 3 months.
“Technically, the stock is positioned well above all significant short, medium, and long-term moving averages.”

In summary, ITI Ltd's stock has shown substantial growth and consistent upward movement, making it a noteworthy company in the telecommunications sector.

item.title: ITC share price dips ahead of ITC Hotels demerger record date. Should you buy? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
ITC Share Price Dips Ahead of ITC Hotels Demerger Record Date

Publication Date: January 5, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

ITC share price dropped over one percent as the company approaches its demerger record date set for January 6. Shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 ITC shares held.

  • ITC's share price fell on January 5, 2024.
  • The demerger record date is January 6, 2024, making it the last chance for investors to buy ITC shares to receive ITC Hotels shares.
  • The demerger ratio is 1:10, meaning for every 10 ITC shares held, investors will receive 1 ITC Hotels share.
  • The special trading session to determine ITC Hotels' share price will occur on January 6.
  • Analysts suggest the current dip could be a buying opportunity for long-term investment.
“Buying ITC shares ahead of the demerger record date could be a good opportunity for long-term investors.” - Akriti Mehrotra, Research Analyst, StoxBox

The dmeger is expected to enhance ITC’s capital efficiency and profitability, particularly in the hotel and FMCG sectors.

item.title: Upcoming Tata SUV Spotted On A Race Track! What’s Happening? - MotorOctane
item.description:
Upcoming Tata Harrier EV Spotted Testing on Race Track

Date: [Publication Date]

Source: MotorOctane

Tata is testing its new Harrier EV, which was spotted on a race track at CoASTT High Performance Centre in Coimbatore. This marks a shift towards performance-centric electric vehicles from Tata.

  • The Harrier EV aims to compete with Mahindra's powerful 282 bhp SUVs.
  • Expected features include a large battery pack, dual motor AWD configuration, and six driving modes.
  • Design changes will include a closed grille and 19-inch aero alloy wheels while maintaining similarities with the ICE version.
  • The vehicle will be showcased at the upcoming Bharat Mobility Show.
"Tata is expected to offer exhilarating performance with its new EVs while still providing a standard range of 400+ km."

This new model is positioned as a strong contender against competitors like Mahindra's XEV 9e and the upcoming Hyundai Creta EV.

item.title: Aprilia Tuono 457 unofficial bookings begin in India - BikeWale
item.description:
Aprilia Tuono 457 Unofficial Bookings Begin in India

Date: October 2023 | Source: BikeWale

Bookings for the Aprilia Tuono 457 have started unofficially in Maharashtra, with online bookings expected to commence soon and deliveries likely starting in February.

  • A few dealers are accepting bookings with a deposit of Rs 10,000.
  • The official launch date and pricing details are anticipated within the next two to three weeks.
  • The Tuono 457 shares components with the Aprilia RS 457, including the chassis and braking system.
  • Specifications include a 457cc engine producing 47bhp and 43.5Nm torque, along with modern features like traction control and a TFT display.
  • It will compete against models like the KTM 390 Duke and BMW G310R.
“The Tuono 457 rides on preload adjustable USD front forks and a monoshock with single disc brakes at both ends.”

The start of unofficial bookings signifies growing anticipation for the Tuono 457, promising an exciting entry into the competitive sports bike market in India.

item.title: KPI Green energy shares trade ex-date today for 1:2 bonus issue, stock down over 4% - The Economic Times
item.description:
KPI Green Energy Shares Trade Ex-Date Today for 1:2 Bonus Issue

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

KPI Green Energy shares have started trading on an ex-bonus basis today for their 1:2 bonus share issue. The stock was down by 4.6%, going down to its intraday low of Rs 545.55 on the BSE.

  • The company has fixed January 03, 2025, as the ‘Record Date’ for determining the eligibility of shareholders for the bonus issue.
  • Shareholders eligible for the bonus issue must have their shares in the demat account by the record date.
  • Those buying the stock on the ex-date are not eligible for dividends, splits, or bonus issues.
  • KPI Green Energy has previously issued bonus shares in February 2024 and 2023.
  • The share price has increased by 77.8% in the last year but has fallen by 8% in the last six months.
“Pursuant to Regulation 42 of Securities and Exchange Board of India...”

In conclusion, KPI Green Energy's stock is experiencing volatility around its bonus issue announcement, reflecting investor sentiment and market conditions.

item.title: Stock market crash: Sensex tumbles 450 points; why is the Indian stock market falling today? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock market crash: Sensex tumbles 450 points; why is the Indian stock market falling today?

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

A day after gaining nearly 2 percent, the Indian stock market benchmarks—the Sensex and the Nifty 50—suffered significant losses in morning trade due to profit booking and a strengthening US dollar.

The Sensex opened at 80,072.99 but fell to 79,274.77 before recovering slightly to close at 79,485.28. Meanwhile, the Nifty 50 dropped to 24,000.25 after opening at 24,196.40, reflecting a troubling trend.

  • Profit booking in heavyweights like HDFC Bank and Infosys has led to the current downturn.
  • Investor sentiment remains cautious ahead of Q3 earnings and global policy shifts.
  • The US dollar is at a two-year high, impacting emerging markets negatively.
  • The IT, banking, and financial sectors are experiencing significant selling pressure.
  • Anticipated market volatility due to upcoming US Fed policy decisions and the Union Budget.
“With the dollar index at 109.25 and the US 10-year yield at 4.56 per cent, the macro construct is not favourable for sustained FII buying.” - V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services.

The current declines in the stock market highlight ongoing investor caution amid global economic uncertainties, and the situation may deteriorate further leading up to key fiscal events.

item.title: Stock market crash: Sensex tumbles nearly 700 points; why is the Indian stock market falling today? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock market crash: Sensex tumbles nearly 700 points; why is the Indian stock market falling today?

Date: January 3, 2023 Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market benchmarks are experiencing notable declines due to profit booking and a strengthening US dollar, following a day of robust gains.

The market opened lower with the Sensex dropping nearly 670 points, influenced by major sectors facing selling pressure. Key factors contributing to this downturn include:

  • Profit booking in heavyweights like HDFC Bank and Infosys.
  • Cautious investor sentiment ahead of Q3 earnings reports.
  • The US dollar reaching a two-year high, affecting foreign capital flows.
  • Weak performance of banking and IT sectors impacting the indices.
  • Anticipation of volatility in light of upcoming policy decisions and the Union Budget.
“With the dollar index at 109.25 and the US 10-year yield at 4.56 percent, the macro construct is not favorable for sustained FII buying.” - V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services

The current situation indicates a challenging environment for investors as they navigate market uncertainties.

item.title: Gold price rises due to safe-haven demand as Biden discusses plans to strike Iran - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Price Rises Due to Safe-Haven Demand as Biden Discusses Plans to Strike Iran

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: FXStreet

Gold prices are on the rise, buoyed by safe-haven demand in light of increasing geopolitical tensions, particularly regarding Iran's nuclear ambitions and other global conflicts.

  • Gold price benefits from safe-haven flows amid Biden's discussions around striking Iran’s nuclear facilities.
  • Gold struggles as US Dollar Index remains high, impacting dollar-denominated prices.
  • US Treasury yields remain low, making gold an attractive investment option.
  • Record purchases by central banks are likely to increase demand for gold.
  • Market reactions closely monitor China's economic recovery and its implications for gold demand.
  • Geopolitical events, including conflicts in Ukraine and Gaza, further influence gold demand.
“Gold could face challenges as the Federal Reserve signals a cautious stance on rate cuts for 2025.”

This increase in gold prices reflects the ongoing concern in the global community regarding geopolitical stability and its effect on financial markets.

item.title: New Affordable Hyundai Creta Rival Launching Next Month! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Kia Launches Bookings for New Syros SUV Ahead of February Reveal

Date: January 2025 | Source: MotorOctane

Kia has opened bookings for their new Syros SUV, priced around Rs 15 Lakh, with deliveries starting in mid-February. The brand will reveal the car's price on February 1, 2025.

  • Bookings opened for Kia Syros with a token amount of Rs 25,000.
  • Deliveries of the SUV are expected to start by mid-February 2025.
  • The SUV boasts segment-first features and advanced technology.
  • Two engine options available: 1.0-litre turbo petrol and 1.5-litre diesel.
  • Price expected to be between Rs 11 lakh and Rs 18 lakh (on-road, Mumbai).
"The new Kia Syros has a combination of a new-age design and advanced tech features."

The Kia Syros SUV represents a significant step for Kia in the SUV market, featuring modern designs and cutting-edge technology aimed at enhancing user experience.

item.title: Top 3 Price Prediction Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple: BTC, ETH and XRP eyes for a rally - FXStreet
item.description:
Top 3 Price Prediction for Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Ripple: BTC, ETH, and XRP Eyeing a Rally

Date: January 3, 2025 Source: FXStreet

This article discusses the current price predictions for Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Ripple, emphasizing their potential upward movements based on recent market behaviors.

  • Bitcoin is finding support at $92,606 and aims for a bullish rally towards $100,000.
  • Ethereum is at a key resistance level of $3,522; a close above this could signal a bullish trend.
  • Ripple is positioned within a symmetrical triangle, with a potential breakout price targeting $3.63.
“If the $92,606 level continues to hold as support, BTC will extend its rally to retest its key psychological importance level of $100,000.”

In conclusion, if these cryptocurrencies break their respective resistance levels, significant gains might be on the horizon, making it essential for investors to stay alert and monitor these levels closely.

item.title: D-Mart Share Price: Avenue Supermarts jumps 15% post Q3 update but analysts remain divided - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Avenue Supermarts Shares Surge 15% After Strong Q3 Report Despite Mixed Analyst Opinions

Date: January 3, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

Avenue Supermarts Ltd., the operator of DMart, saw its shares hit a 15% upper circuit after reporting a notable 17.5% growth in sales for the third quarter, signaling a positive trend despite mixed reviews from financial analysts.

  • Shares rose to ₹4,152.75 on the announcement of record sales figures.
  • CLSA maintains an 'Outperform' rating with a target of ₹5,360, suggesting a 48% potential upside.
  • Morgan Stanley recommends 'Underweight' with a target of ₹3,702, citing ongoing weak growth trends.
  • Goldman Sachs has a 'Sell' rating with a target of ₹3,425, concerned about increased discounting impacting margins.
  • Citi also has a 'Sell' rating, highlighting risks from competitive pressures in quick commerce.
  • Avenue Supermarts added 10 new stores, bringing the total to 387 during this quarter.
“The growth trend improved sequentially; however, the company remains well below the historical 20% topline growth algorithm for the business.” - Morgan Stanley

The mixed responses from analysts indicate a cautious outlook for Avenue Supermarts despite the recent spike in share prices, as competition in the retail space intensifies.

item.title: Avenue Supermarts shares skyrocket 15% as company's revenue in Q3 surges 17.5% YoY; check other details - Upstox
item.description:
Avenue Supermarts Shares Surge 15% Following Strong Q3 Revenue Growth

Date: January 3, 2025

Source: PTI

Avenue Supermarts, operators of DMart, saw a 15% increase in share prices after announcing significant revenue growth for Q3 FY25.

  • Shares rose to ₹4,152.75 on the NSE.
  • Standalone revenue for Q3 FY25 was ₹15,565.23 crore, up 17.49% YoY.
  • Total number of stores increased to 387 with 10 new additions this quarter.
“Overall, H1 FY 2025 like-for-like revenue growth was 7.4% for 2 years and older stores.” - Neville Noronha, CEO & Managing Director

This robust growth reflects Avenue Supermarts' strong market presence and operational success, indicating positive trends in the retail sector.

item.title: IRFC shares in focus after MoU with REMCL to finance renewable energy projects - The Economic Times
item.description:
IRFC Shares Jump 3% on Signing MoU with REMCL to Finance Renewable Energy Projects

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Economic Times

Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) shares increased by 3% following the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Railway Energy Management Company Ltd (REMCL) to finance renewable energy projects aimed at powering Indian Railways.

  • IRFC will explore financing options for renewable, thermal, and nuclear power projects.
  • The collaboration aims to help Indian Railways achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2030.
  • REMCL will leverage its expertise in energy procurement while IRFC will contribute its financial expertise.
  • The partnership represents a strategic shift for IRFC towards diversifying its business model.
“This MoU sets the foundation for cooperation between IRFC and REMCL to advance Indian Railways' goal of minimizing reliance on fossil fuels.”

Overall, this collaboration highlights a commitment to environmentally sustainable solutions in transportation.

item.title: REC, PFC shares may rise up to 31% from current levels, Emkay says - CNBCTV18
item.description:
REC, PFC shares may rise up to 31% from current levels, Emkay says

Date: Jan 3, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm Emkay Global has initiated coverage on shares of state-run power financing companies REC Ltd. and Power Finance Corporation (PFC), assigning both a 'Buy' rating.

  • Emkay has set a price target of ₹650 for REC and ₹600 for PFC, suggesting potential upsides of 25% and 31%, respectively.
  • Both REC and PFC have decreased more than 20% from their record highs in July 2024.
  • Emkay cites sustained double-digit loan growth and strong asset quality as key factors for their positive outlook.
“The controlled upcycle in power capital expenditure and lending is here to stay, and both REC and PFC offer an optimal pathway to capitalise on this trend.”

The brokerage projects robust growth for both firms, driven by strong credit demand and favorable economic conditions.

item.title: REC and PFC shares may rise up to 31% from current levels, Emkay says - CNBCTV18
item.description:
REC and PFC Shares Expected to Rise by Up to 31%, Says Emkay

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Brokerage firm Emkay Global has initiated coverage on shares of state-run power financing companies REC Ltd. and Power Finance Corporation (PFC), assigning both a 'Buy' rating.

Emkay has set a price target of ₹650 for REC and ₹600 for PFC, implying a potential upside of 25% and 31%, respectively, from Thursday's closing levels.

  • REC and PFC are down over 20% from their record highs.
  • Emkay's optimistic outlook is based on long-term capital expenditure plans in the sector.
  • Valuations remain reasonable despite higher estimates when considering growth potential.
“Sustained double-digit loan growth and improving asset quality support robust earnings visibility for companies in the sector.”

The brokerage anticipates strong credit demand and robust earnings, despite players trading at a discount to their book values.

item.title: Blinkit launches 10-minute ambulance service in Gurgaon - The Times of India
item.description:
Blinkit Launches 10-Minute Ambulance Service in Gurgaon

Publication Date: October 23, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Blinkit has introduced a new 10-minute ambulance service in Gurgaon, aimed at providing rapid medical assistance to patients in emergencies.

  • The service is designed to address the critical need for timely medical intervention.
  • Blinkit aims to leverage its existing logistics network to facilitate quick access to ambulances.
  • This initiative could significantly reduce emergency response times and potentially save lives.
  • The service is available via the Blinkit app for quick booking.
“This service underscores our commitment to innovation in the healthcare space.” - Blinkit CEO

The introduction of this service marks an important step towards ensuring better healthcare access in urban areas.

item.title: Stocks to buy: Ankush Bajaj recommends three stocks for today—3 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Ankush Bajaj Recommends Three Stocks for January 3, 2025

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Stock Market News

The Indian stock market ended on a positive note, with notable gains observed in the auto, IT, and consumption sectors. The Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex both reported significant increases, although the Nifty Media sector saw declines.

  • The Nifty 50 closed at 24,188.65.

  • The Nifty Media sector lagged behind, closing in the red.

item.title: ITC demerger record date: TODAY! Last date to BUY to get ITC Hotels shares FREE - ET Now
item.description:
ITC Demerger Record Date: Last Chance to Buy Shares for Free ITC Hotels Shares

Updated: January 3, 2025, Source: ET NOW News

January 3 is the last date to buy ITC shares to qualify for ITC Hotels shares. With the ex-date falling on January 6, investors must act before January 4-5, when markets will be closed.

  • ITC shares must be bought by January 3 to qualify for ITC Hotels shares.
  • Pre-open session for price discovery on January 6, 2025, at 9:00 AM.
  • ITC Hotels will continue within indices for three trading days post-demerger.
  • Shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares of ITC held.
  • Market experts predict varying target prices for ITC shares, with some reaching upwards of Rs 575.
“ITC will continue to hold 40% stake in ITC Hotels which should be seen as a positive for shareholders.” - Amnish Aggarwal, Head - Research, Prabhudas Lilladher

The impending ITC Hotels demerger is poised to benefit both sectors and shareholders, showcasing strategic value creation within ITC Ltd.
